Articles.Content:
Hello!

I'm new to KSP, so forgive me if this is a very stupid question. Anyways! Seeing as I can hardly get anything into orbit, I'm using pre-made "Scenarios". The refueling outpost, to be exact. I noticed a spacecraft attached to the station and did an EVA to get one of my Kerbal's into the spacecraft. Now, I'm confused as to how I can control it/detach it from the station? I tried igniting the engines via "SPACE' and other things, but it still is in control of the station. I would love some help here. Again, forgive me if it's a dumb question!

Thanks.

if the spacebar does not work, it probably means it's linked by a docking port, a clamp-o-tron. right-click on it or it's counterpart (normally two identical parts facing each other) and you should have a "decouple" or "undock" option.
Once you successfully undock the craft, you may also need to press the [ or ] key to change control from the station to the undocked craft.

The space bar is only used to advance in the staging of a craft. When ships are docked, it is not uncommon that the staging is a bit messed up.

When in doubt, right click!

if the spacebar does not work, it probably means it's linked by a docking port, a clamp-o-tron. right-click on it or it's counterpart (normally two identical parts facing each other) and you should have a "decouple" or "undock" option.

This should work
